newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish govt sets 1998-99 budget spending ceilings.
newsitem.headline: Finnish govt sets 1998-99 budget spending ceilings.

text.p: The Finnish government said on Tuesday it had agreed on spending ceilings for the two remaining annual budgets of its term in office to 1999.
The five-party left-right-green government capped 1998 budget expenditure at 191 billion markka and set a 192 billion markka ceiling for 1999, it said in a statement.
Total spending in the 1997 state budget approved by parliament is 190.3 billion markka.
The government also set tentative expenditure frames beyond its own term in office, projecting 2000 spending at 190 billion markka and 2001 spending at 191 billion.
"In creating the (budget) framework the basis has been to implement tight expenditure discipline in all discretionary spending," the government said.
The projections were based on slowing GDP growth in 1998-2001.
"The medium-term projection suggests that growth will slow down from 1998 onwards with the GDP growth rate between 3.8 and 2.8 percent in 1998-2001," the government said.
The finance ministry on February 18 forecast Finnish 1997 GDP growth at 4.6 percent.
